articles.title: Val Kilmer's official cause of death revealed

neutral.headline: Val Kilmer's Cause of Death Revealed in Death Certificate
neutral.body:
The cause of death for beloved actor Val Kilmer has been officially confirmed as pneumonia, as stated in his death certificate. The news of Kilmer's passing was shared by his daughter on April 1st.
Val Kilmer, known for his roles in films such as "Top Gun" and "Batman Forever," had been battling health issues in recent years. His struggle with throat cancer and subsequent treatments had been well-documented, leading to concerns about his health among his fans and the public.
Pneumonia, a common and sometimes serious illness, is an infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs. It can range from mild to severe and is often a complication of other underlying health conditions.
Kilmer's death has been met with an outpouring of grief and tributes from fans, friends, and colleagues in the entertainment industry. His contributions to film and his memorable performances will continue to be celebrated and remembered by all who were touched by his work.
